availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Henry Garrard (Franklin County, Kentucky, salt maker and Kentucky state treasurer)

body.p: Franklin County, Kentucky, salt maker and Kentucky state treasurer. Kentucky native. Married to Lettitia J. Garrard. Father of Toleman Garrard, Daniel Garrard, Mittie Garrard, James L. Garrard, Lucy J. Garrard, Florence Garrard, and Ellen W. Garrard. Salt Maker in Clay County in 1850. Owned twenty enslaved persons in Clay County in 1850. Treasurer of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from 1857 to 1865. Owned three enslaved persons in Clay County in 1860. Member of the Democratic Party in 1857. Ran as a pro-Union candidate in 1861.

ab.bibl:
"Election Returns," Louisville Daily Courier (Louisville, Ky.), August 16, 1861, p. 1.
Louisville Daily Courier (Louisville, Ky.), June 27, 1857, p. 2.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedule, Clay County, Kentucky District, p. 102A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedule, Clay County, Kentucky District, p. 224.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Franklin County, Frankfort, p. 243-4.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedule, Franklin County, Frankfort, p. 349B, 350B.
Find A Grave, "James H. Garrard (1810-1865)," Memorial #95589594, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/95589594 (accessed May 23, 2017).
